question: Question_05_(b)
sols:
Setting the derivative to 0 and solving gives

$0 = 4x^{3} - 12x^2 + 8x = 4x(x^2-3x + 2) = 4x(x-1)(x-2)$

and thus, the steady states are $x=0,1,2$. At the point a, the
derivative is positive and so the function $x(t)$ is increasing and thus
approaches the steady state 1 (the first steady states bigger than a).
At \emph{b}, the dervative is negative hence the function is negative
and thus approaches the steady state 1. At \emph{c}, the derivative is
positive and so the function is increasing and as \emph{t} approaches
infinity, the function $x(t)$ approaches infinity.

hints:
Steady states are found in this case by solving for the values of
\emph{x} when the derivative is 0.

At points \emph{a},\emph{b} and \emph{c} to see what happens as time
approaches infinity, you need to know whether the derivative is positive
(hence the function is increasing) or negative (hence the function is
decreasing).
